intro: Rudgea umbrosa, commonly known as the shadowy rudgea, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface. Rudgea umbrosa thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of humid tropical forests.
